Text: The Gotha Go 149 was a military aircraft developed in Germany in the mid-1930s for training fighter pilots.
Triplets:<The Gotha Go 149
1:
--------------------
<Text: Gotha Go 149:  It was a conventional low-wing cantilever monoplane with tailwheel undercarriage, the main units of which retracted inwards.>
Triplets:<Gotha Go 149
2:
--------------------
<Text: Gotha Go 149:  The wing was wooden, while the monocoque fuselage was metal.>
